name: UNICEF Ambassadors
description: A student-led initiative focused on promoting children's rights and humanitarian values. Members participate in awareness campaigns, fundraising events, and community service projects that support UNICEF's mission to protect and advocate for children worldwide.
shortDescription: Promoting children's rights and humanitarian values through awareness campaigns and community service.

events.title: Children's Rights Awareness Week
events.description: Week-long campaign to raise awareness about children's rights in our community

events.title: UNICEF Fundraising Gala
events.description: Annual fundraising event to support UNICEF's global programs

name: Interact Club
description: A Rotary-sponsored service club for young people aged 12-18. Members develop leadership skills while working on local and international community service projects. The club focuses on developing leadership skills, personal integrity, helpfulness, respect for others, and international understanding.
shortDescription: Rotary-sponsored service club developing leadership skills through community service projects.

events.title: Community Clean-up Day
events.description: Volunteer event to clean up local parks and streets

events.title: International Youth Exchange
events.description: Cultural exchange program with students from partner schools

name: Model United Nations
Model United Nations
description: Students simulate United Nations committees and debate current global issues. Participants develop research, public speaking, and diplomatic skills while learning about international relations, current events, and the UN system. The club regularly participates in regional and national MUN conferences.
shortDescription: Simulate UN committees and debate global issues while developing diplomatic and public speaking skills.

events.title: Bangkok MUN Conference
events.description: Regional Model UN conference with schools from across Bangkok

events.title: Internal MUN Simulation
events.description: Practice session for upcoming external conferences

name: Moot Court
description: Students participate in simulated court proceedings, arguing legal cases before mock judges. This competitive program develops critical thinking, legal reasoning, and public speaking skills. Members learn about constitutional law, civil rights, and the judicial system through hands-on experience.
shortDescription: Simulate court proceedings and develop legal reasoning skills through competitive mock trials.

events.title: National Moot Court Competition
events.description: Annual competition against other schools nationwide

events.title: Legal Workshop Series
events.description: Workshop on constitutional law and civil rights

name: Operation Smile
description: A global medical charity that provides free surgeries for children born with cleft lip, cleft palate, and other facial deformities. Student members organize fundraising events, awareness campaigns, and volunteer opportunities to support the organization's mission of transforming lives through safe surgery.
shortDescription: Support children with facial deformities through fundraising and awareness campaigns for free surgeries.

events.title: Smile Gala Fundraiser
events.description: Annual fundraising gala to support Operation Smile's medical missions

events.title: Awareness Campaign
events.description: School-wide campaign to educate about cleft conditions

name: Sports Club
description: A teacher-led program offering various sports activities and training sessions. Students can participate in basketball, volleyball, swimming, and track & field. The club focuses on physical fitness, teamwork, and sportsmanship while preparing students for school competitions and tournaments.
shortDescription: Teacher-led sports program offering basketball, volleyball, swimming, and track & field training.
meetingInfo: Every Monday, Wednesday, Friday, 4:00 PM - 6:00 PM

events.title: Inter-School Sports Tournament
events.description: Annual competition against other schools in the district

events.title: Sports Day
events.description: School-wide sports celebration and friendly competitions
